title: Publications
description: Schema for the JSON-Output of a List of publications by the API-v1 of FreiDok plus

numFound.description: Number of searchresults for the given request.

maxRows.description: Maximum number of results per request.

type.description: Describes the type of this JSON-object

link.description: Link to the publication's landingpage in FreiDok plus.

owner.description: Information about authentification. ONLY VISIBLE FOR ADMINS OR OWNERS.

type.description: type of authentification

type_value.description: language-dependend description for type of authentification

value.description: eppn or lopes-ID of the owner

examples.value:
Background
Apoid wasps and bees (Apoidea) are an ecologically and morphologically diverse group of Hymenoptera, with some species of bees having evolved eusocial societies. Major problems for our understanding of the evolutionary history of Apoidea have been the difficulty to trace the phylogenetic origin and to reliably estimate the geological age of bees. To address these issues, we compiled a comprehensive phylogenomic dataset by simultaneously analyzing target DNA enrichment and transcriptomic sequence data, comprising 195 single-copy protein-coding genes and covering all major lineages of apoid wasps and bee families.

Results
Our compiled data matrix comprised 284,607 nucleotide sites that we phylogenetically analyzed by applying a combination of domain- and codon-based partitioning schemes. The inferred results confirm the polyphyletic status of the former family “Crabronidae”, which comprises nine major monophyletic lineages. We found the former subfamily Pemphredoninae to be polyphyletic, comprising three distantly related clades. One of them, Ammoplanina, constituted the sister group of bees in all our analyses. We estimate the origin of bees to be in the Early Cretaceous (ca. 128 million years ago), a time period during which angiosperms rapidly radiated. Finally, our phylogenetic analyses revealed that within the Apoidea, (eu)social societies evolved exclusively in a single clade that comprises pemphredonine and philanthine wasps as well as bees.

Conclusion
By combining transcriptomic sequences with those obtained via target DNA enrichment, we were able to include an unprecedented large number of apoid wasps in a phylogenetic study for tracing the phylogenetic origin of bees. Our results confirm the polyphyletic nature of the former wasp family Crabonidae, which we here suggest splitting into eight families. Of these, the family Ammoplanidae possibly represents the extant sister lineage of bees. Species of Ammoplanidae are known to hunt thrips, of which some aggregate on flowers and feed on pollen. The specific biology of Ammoplanidae as predators indicates how the transition from a predatory to pollen-collecting life style could have taken place in the evolution of bees. This insight plus the finding that (eu)social societies evolved exclusively in a single subordinated lineage of apoid wasps provides new perspectives for future comparative studies.

classifications.description: List of classification-assignments for classifications, that are imported to FreiDok plus.

title_parents.description: List of arrays, that contain references to parent publications

items.description: List of parent- (first entry), grand-parent- (second entry) and-so-on-publication-references.

persons.description: List of persons involved in this publication

items.description: Information about a perosn involved in this publication

type.description: attribute-id of the person's role

type_value.description: language-dependend description of the person's role

norm_id.description: id of the person in FreiDok plus

link.description: url to the person's landingpage in FreiDok plus

is_corresponding_author.description: if the person is one of the corresponding authors of this publication

marcxml.description: MarcXML-id of the person's role (mapping to MarcXML)

datacite.description: Datacite-id of the person's role (mapping to Datacite)

orcid_link.description: url to the ORCiD-Entry of the person

gnd_link.description: url to the GND-Entry of the person

name_forms.description: List of available names for this person. ONLY VISIBLE IF edit=true.

items.description: Entry for a name of this person

selected.description: if this name of the person is selected for this publication

affiliations.description: List of affiliations of this person regarding this publication

norm_id.description: FreiDok plus identifier for the insitutiton

sup_no.description: Footnote-number matching to an entry in 'affiliations_list'

lifetime.description: Lifetime of the insitution. ONLY VISIBLE IF edit=true.

link.description: Link to the institution's landingpage in FreiDok plus. NOT NEEDED?

author_function.description: Function of this person for this publication

type.description: attribute-id of the function

sup_no.description: Footnote-character matching to an entry in 'functions_list'

import_info.description: information about the process of choosing this person for the publication

matching_type.description: tells, how the person was chosen: orcid/gnd/name/user/admin

orcid_imported.description: ORCiD, that was provided by import-data

gnd_imported.description: GND-No, that was provided by import-data

grouping.description: grouping of this entry. ONLY VISIBLE IF edit=true.

persons_stat.description: Additional statistical information about the persons for this publication, e.g. total number of persons.

total_count.description: Total number of persons belonging to this publication.

additional_count.description: Number of persons, which are not shown, because parameter maxPers was reached.

affiliations_list.description: List of affiliations used by persons in this publication.

sup_no.description: Footnote-number matching to sup_no of a person's 'affiliations'-list

functions_list.description: List of functions used by persons in this publication.

type.description: attribute-id of the function

sup_no.description: Footnote-character matching to sup_no of a person's 'author_function'
